alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Randolph; St. Clair; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 15 at 7:09PM CDT until April 15 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Clinton County in south central Illinois... Washington County in south central Illinois... Northeastern Randolph County in southwestern Illinois... Eastern St. Clair County in southwestern Illinois... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 708 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing a tornado were located along a line extending from Shiloh to Marissa, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * These tornadic storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Clinton, Washington, northeastern Randolph and eastern St. Clair Counties, including the following locations... Bartelso, Huey, Posen, New Minden, Eden, Oakdale, Cordes, Hoyleton, Covington , and Richview. This also includes Carlyle Lake Recreational Area. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 19 and 61. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
